cli.language_not_available: Language '{lang}' is not available. Falling back to {fallback}.

min_help.migrate_desc: # Migrate key to OS credential store

general_options.migrate: Migrate stored key to OS credential store
general_options.lang: Override language for this run (also saves preference)

key.description: Securely register, migrate, or delete your GitHub API token.
examples: exc key                 # Prompt for the token and save it securely
exc key ghp_xxx         # Provide the token inline (avoids prompt)
exc key --reset         # Delete the stored token
exc key --migrate       # Move the token into the OS credential store
key.prompt_hint: If you omit the token argument, EXC will prompt you with hidden input.

analysis.description: Performs a detailed analysis of a GitHub repository: code quality, security, dependencies, and statistics.

user_a.description: Inspect a GitHub user's profile, follower stats, and headline repositories.
details: - Highlights top repositories and contribution streaks
- Surfaces recent public activity for anomaly checks
user_a.tip: Tip: Provide the username exactly as it appears on GitHub.

scan_secrets.description: Scans the last N commits (default 10) for secrets like API keys, AWS credentials, SSH keys, and tokens.
options: -l, --limit   Number of recent commits to scan (default: 10)

file_history.description: Displays the full change history of a specific file (commit, author, date, message).

dork_scan.description: Scan public GitHub code for sensitive keywords, secrets, or configuration files using advanced dorking techniques.
options: <dork_query>         The search query (can be multiple words, quoted if needed)
-n, --num N          Number of results to show (default: 10, max: 100)
-h, --help           Show this help message and exit
details: This command allows you to search public GitHub repositories for exposed secrets, API keys, tokens, or sensitive files using custom search queries (dorks).
You can combine keywords, file extensions, and filename filters for more precise results.
tips: Use quotes for multi-word queries (e.g. "sensitive key")
Results include repository, file path, and direct link to the file on GitHub

advanced_secrets.description: Scans repository files and the last N commits for a wide range of secret patterns (API keys, tokens, config files, etc.).
options: -l, --limit   Number of recent commits to scan (default: 20)

security_score.description: Calculates a security score for the repository based on open issues, branch protection, security.md, license, dependabot, code scanning, and more.

commit_anomaly.description: Analyzes commit messages and PRs for suspicious or risky activity.

user_anomaly.description: Detects unusual activity or anomalies in a user's GitHub activity.

content_audit.description: Audits the repository for license, security.md, code of conduct, contributing.md, and documentation quality.

actions_audit.description: Analyzes GitHub Actions/CI workflow files for security risks and best practices.
